RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 1 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 77. Maiden Special Weight Purse 90000. (UP TO $15,660 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAGIC CROSS off half a beat slow at the start, came under coaxing and chased along the inside just off the pace dispute up front, angled four wide into upper stretch, took over command straightened away and went clear under a drive to prevail. DOROTHY'S DREAMS got bumped between foes who each broke her way at the start, chased four wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, spun three wide for home, angled out nearing the sixteenth marker and kicked home belatedly in tandem with EXHILARATE to her outside and was just up for the place honors. EXHILARATE coaxed from the start, chased three wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, angled out five to six wide into upper stretch and kicked on belatedly in concert with the aforementioned foe and was along for the show honors. SEVEN NATTY PATTY brushed the near side stall at the start when breaking in a step, pressed four wide latched on outside the top pair, had to steady off heels when coming in slightly as DEVIL AT MIDNIGHT came slightly outwards near the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch and weakened in the final furlong. DEVIL AT MIDNIGHT broke in at the start bumping DOROTHY'S DREAMS in tandem with LA PICASITA, dueled from the three path with SUGAR N SPICE to her inside while joined outside by the aforementioned foe, came out slightly when placed to coaxing near the five-sixteenths forcing SEVEN NATTY PATTY to steady when she came in slightly at that juncture, continued three wide into upper stretch and weakened. MY STARSHIP coaxed from the gate, chased three wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, angled five wide into upper stretch, made no impact. LA PICASITA broke out at the start bumping DOROTHY'S DREAMS in concert with DEVIL AT MIDNIGHT, chased along the inside under a ride from the three-eighths, continued inside into upper stretch and made no impact. SUGAR N SPICE coaxed from the gate, dueled from the two path with DEVIL AT MIDNIGHT to her outside and SEVEN NATTY PATTY applying pressure to both stacked outside that rival, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, took the inside route into upper stretch yielding command and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Sugar N Spice
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, dueled 2p, coaxed 5/16, ins 1/4p, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Magic Cross
ENTRY.COMMENT: off 1/2 slw st, ins off pace dispute, 4w uppr, up, went clear

ENTRY.NAME: Exhilarate
ENTRY.OWNER: Claiborne Farm and Dilschneider, Adele B.
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 3w, coaxed 3/8, angled 5-6w upper, belatedly

ENTRY.NAME: La Picasita
ENTRY.OWNER: Miranda Katie Rosen Fred Steinmetz Equine Holdings LLC New Phoenix Stable and Wi
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, chased inside, coaxed 3/8, ins 1/4, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Dorothy's Dreams
ENTRY.COMMENT: bump betw st, chased 4w, coaxed 3/8, 3w upper, belatedly

ENTRY.NAME: Devil At Midnight
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in st, dueled 3w, coaxed 5/16, 3w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Seven Natty Patty
ENTRY.OWNER: Baccari Racing Stable LLC and Dream Walkin Farms Inc
ENTRY.COMMENT: brush gate st, pressed 4w, steady 5/16, 5w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: My Starship
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 3w, coaxed 3/8, angled 5w upper, no impact

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 2 1M Dirt CR: 87. Claiming Purse 36000. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Weight, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races At A Mile Or Over In 2023 Allowed 3 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 5 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500 (Maiden And Claiming Races For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COOL QUARTET prompted the pace on the outside of the leader, turned up the pressure in the three path on the turn, took a short lead at the quarter-pole, came under a right-handed crop in upper stretch, switched to a left-handed crop while battling inside of the runner-up into the final furlong, disposed of that foe outside the sixteenth-pole and drew away under steady urging to prove much the best. ZERTZ tracked the pace on the outside, was given his cue in the four path on the turn, made a bid late on that bend, battled outside of the winner under a right-handed crop in upper stretch, switched to a left-handed crop at the furlong marker, lost touch with the winner outside the sixteenth-pole and proved no match under a strong hand-ride from that point while able to hold the place. CARIBBEAN (AUS) dropped back on the outside then settled at the rear, was urged along late on the backstretch, went three then two wide on the turn and lacked the needed response while best of the rest. DRINK THE WIND went to the front, showed the way on the inside of a foe, vied in the two path on the turn, was asked inside the three-eighths pole, lost the advantage at the quarter-pole and tired. MOLIERE was hustled from the gate, dropped back early then settled near the rear under some urging, saved ground on the turn and failed to respond.

ENTRY.NAME: Moliere
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,dropped back,settled,inside turn,no response

ENTRY.NAME: Drink the Wind
ENTRY.COMMENT: pace inside foe,2path turn,asked ins3/8,headed1/4,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Cool Quartet
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted outside,3path turn,lead1/4,ins foe past1/8,drew away

ENTRY.NAME: Caribbean (AUS)
ENTRY.COMMENT: dropped back outside,settled,urged5/8,3-2path turn,best rest

ENTRY.NAME: Zertz
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked outside,asked 4path turn,bid1/4,vied past 1/8,no match

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 3 7F Turf CR: 80. Maiden Special Weight Purse 90000. (UP TO $15,660 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Seven Furlongs on the Main Track.) (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EMPATHY chased just off the inside before tucking inside into the turn, tipped out three wide placed to coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive coming in two paths and bumped with RISK FREE when taking command from that rival seventy yards from home to prevail at the end. RISK FREE chased just off the inside from just off the pace, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled four wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive taking narrow command a sixteenth out, got bumped by the aforementioned foe when headed for the front seventy yards from the finish and fought on to the end. SPUN SPECIAL prompted the pace from the outside four then three wide, took over command inside the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, dug in under threat and was collared near the sixteenth marker, ran on to preserve the show honors. DORAL chased three wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, continued three wide into upper stretch, weakened in the late stages. PARTY IS OVER chased three then two wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, swung four wide into upper stretch, weakened. POSITIVE MESSAGE (GB) chased along the inside under coaxing from the three-eighths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, weakened. ROMEINADAY chased along the inside under coaxing from the three-eighths, angled four wide into upper stretch, made no impact. CLASSIC PERFORMER showed the way in hand along the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, yielded the front inside that station and took the inside route into upper stretch, then tired through to the finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Positive Message (GB)
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, coaxed 3/8, 2w 1/4p, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Romeinaday
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, coaxed 3/8, angled 4w upper, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Empathy
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, tip 3w 5/16, 5w upper, came in, bumped foe, up late

ENTRY.NAME: Doral
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3w, coaxed 3/8, 3w upper, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Classic Performer
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand ins, coaxed 5/16, yielded, ins 1/4, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Risk Free
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, coaxed 5/16, 4w upper, bumped late, fought on

ENTRY.NAME: Party Is Over
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-2w, coaxed 3/8, 4w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Spun Special
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted 4-3w, up ins 5/16, 2w 1/4p, dug in, caught 1/16p, ran on

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 94. Allowance Purse 95000. (UP TO $16,530 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter Allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BOUNCER broke out then was corrected by the rider, tracked the pace on the outside, ranged up in the two path on the turn, made a bid at the five-sixteenths, took the lead in the three path into upper stretch then cruised clear, responded well when shaken up inside the three-sixteenths, maintained a safe advantage under a confident hand ride in the final furlong and proved best. FENWICK settled off the pace, saved ground on the turn, was roused near the five-sixteenths, turned into the stretch in the two path, angled out under a drive inside the three-sixteenths, gained on the leader into the final furlong, moved in outside the sixteenth-pole and finished with good courage for the place. LEDDY broke awkwardly and was last to commence then dropped back, raced at the rear under urging, shifted from the two path to the four path nearing the three-eighths, was driven five wide into upper stretch, gained into the final furlong and finished willingly for the show. ON THE COME UP went to the front then sped clear, raced inside on the turn, was asked under threat inside the five-sixteenths, lost the advantage into upper stretch and tired. RETURN THE RING settled on the outside, was roused in the three path on the turn, came four wide into upper stretch and failed to rally.

ENTRY.NAME: Fenwick
ENTRY.OWNER: Villa Rosa Farm Inc and Kimel Michael
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled,ins turn,ask5/16,2p1/4,angld out,mvd in ins1/8,gd courage

ENTRY.NAME: Leddy
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward brk,dropped back,urged,2-4path turn,5p3/16,willingly

ENTRY.NAME: Return the Ring
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled outside,roused 3path turn,4w into upper,failed to rally

ENTRY.NAME: On the Come Up
ENTRY.COMMENT: clear pace,inside turn,asked ins 5/16,headed into upper,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Bouncer
ENTRY.OWNER: Barber Gary and D J Stable LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out,trckd out,2p trn,bid5/16,lead3p into upper,clr,riddn out

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Suburban S. - Grade2 BELMONT PARK RACE 5 1 1/4M Dirt CR: 110. Stakes Purse 350000. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Non-Lasix Race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $350 which should accompany the nomination. $1,750 to pass the entry box and an additional $1,750 to start. A s upplemental nomination fee of $1,750 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the owner of the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weights: 124 lbs. Non-winners of a Grade One at a mile or over in 2022-23 allowed 2 lbs.; of a Grade Two at a mile or over in 2022-23 allowed 4 lbs.; of a Grade Three at a mile or over in 2022-23 allowed6 lbs. The first four finishers of the Suburban will have all fees waived if they start in the 2023 Grade One Jockey Club Gold Cup in Saratoga on September 2nd. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner. Closed Saturday, June 24, 2023 with 17 Nominaa
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHARGE IT forwardly placed three then two wide through the first turn, advanced on the leader five paths off the inside into the backstretch to poke a head in front just inside one mile remaining, tucked four wide midway down the backstretch shaking away to a safe advantage on hold and patiently handled, tucked three wide nine-sixteenths from home and began to slip away given a notch to work with, tucked to the two path three furlongs from home, came under light coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun two to three wide into upper stretch, had the rider look under his right arm and then over his left shoulder in the vicinity of the three-sixteenths and was roused, edged clear under vigorous hand urging and was ridden out to the finish. CLAPTON three then two wide through the opening bend, raced five paths off the inside down the backstretch at the tail of the field early on, advanced steadily to be just off the pace when placed to light coaxing half a mile from home tucked three wide, continued three wide through the turn coming under intensified urging and into upper stretch, proved no match for the top one while running on clear of the rest to be along second best. UNBRIDLED BOMBER four then three wide through the first turn, raced four wide in pursuit coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, continued four wide into upper stretch and kept on under a drive to improve position and secure the show honors on the line. RED RUN established the front from the get go and showed the way through the first turn just off the inside into the backstretch before being displaced on the front by the eventual winner just inside one mile to run, chased just off the inside until tucked inside into the far turn, came under urging at the three-eighths, continued in the inside route into upper stretch and weakened. TONAL IMPACT along the inside through the first turn, chased three then two wide coming under encouragement at the seven-sixteenths, angled out six wide into upper stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Tonal Impact
ENTRY.COMMENT: ins 1st turn, chased 3-2w, coaxed 7/16, 6w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Red Run
ENTRY.COMMENT: led early on 2p, headed ins 1M, chased ins, inside 1/4, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Clapton
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-2w 1st turn, 5w backstretch, to 3p 9/16, 3w upper, second best

ENTRY.NAME: Charge It
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-2w 1st turn, up ins 1M 5-4w, 3-2w far turn, 2-3w uppr, edged cl

ENTRY.NAME: Unbridled Bomber
ENTRY.OWNER: Potash Edward C Yankanich Brad and Ryerson James T
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-3w 1st turn, chased 4w, coaxed 3/8, 4w upper, kept on

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 6 6F Turf CR: 83. Allowance Purse 80000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter Allowed 2 lbs. (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Six Furlongs on the Main Track.) (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LOON CRY was rated on the outside, tucked into the two path for the run around the turn, moved to the three path late on that bend, was roused five wide into the stretch, rallied to the lead coming to the furlong marker, put away the runner-up near the sixteenth-pole and drew clear under steady urging. WEEKEND RAGS was hustled from the gate, contested the pace on the outside then in the three path on the turn, was put to a drive while in front in upper stretch, lost the advantage to the winner nearing the furlong marker, battled with that foe to near the sixteenth-pole and was outfinished while able to hold the place. ROYAL DANCER was well placed just off the pace, traveled around the turn in the two path, shifted four wide while roused at the quarter-pole, made a brief bid near the furlong marker but was out-kicked while able to get the show. CANDY MONET settled on the outside, moved from three to five wide on the turn, came six wide into the stretch, chased outside into the final furlong, swapped back to her inside lead inside the sixteenth-pole and lacked the needed kick. SIKUM settled off the pace, saved ground on the turn, turned into the stretch in the two path, dropped back under a drive into the final furlong and lacked the needed response. ROBYN AND ELI broke a step slow, settled at the rear, went three then four wide on the turn, came six wide into the stretch and failed to threaten. QUICK POWER NAP was hustled from the gate, contested the pace on the inside of a foe, vied along the rail on the turn, dropped back into upper stretch and capitulated. I'M NERVOUS NOW angled in early while settling off the pace, rounded the turn in the two path, moved out while asked for her best in upper stretch and failed to rally. RANTING stumbled at the start and spotted the front a few lengths, settled towards the rear, went three wide on the turn and was no factor. KREESA LA WROTE dropped back while urged along, saved ground on the turn and showed little. LONGLIVE THE QUEEN tracked the pace on the outside, dropped back while three then four wide on the turn and retreated.

ENTRY.NAME: Ranting
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled brk,settled towards rear,3w turn,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Kreesa La Wrote
ENTRY.COMMENT: dropped back,urged along,saved ground,no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Quick Power Nap
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,pace inside foe,inside turn,capitulated

ENTRY.NAME: Royal Dancer
ENTRY.OWNER: Diamond M Stable Throne Racing and Lianna Stables Inc
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed, 2path turn, 4wide 1/4, bid 1/8, out-kicked, earn 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Robyn and Eli
ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slow,settled at rear,3-4w turn,6w1/4,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Sikum
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, inside turn, 2path into lane, lacked needed kick

ENTRY.NAME: I'm Nervous Now
ENTRY.COMMENT: angled in,settled,2path turn,failed to rally

ENTRY.NAME: Candy Monet
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled outside,3-5w turn,6w into lane,lacked needed kick

ENTRY.NAME: Weekend Rags
ENTRY.OWNER: NY Final Furlong Racing Stable and WLIR Racing Stables
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,outside pace,3p turn,vied to 1/16,outfinished,held2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Loon Cry
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated outside,tucked 2-3p turn,roused 5w1/4,rallied,lead1/8,clear

ENTRY.NAME: Longlive the Queen
ENTRY.OWNER: West Point Thoroughbreds Lucky Hat Racing LLC and Winters Equine LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked outside, dropped back 3-4path turn, retreated

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 106. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 100000. (UP TO $17,400 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 TWICE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR OPTIONAL CLAIMING PRICE OF $62,500. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Ol der, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Other Than Claiming Or Starter In 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race In 2023 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $62,500 (Allowance Horses Preferred)(1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void ).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DOT'S DOLLAR chased five then four wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung five wide into upper stretch, closed well to issue a challenge through the final furlong and was up between foes in the final jumps to prevail. MILTON THE MONSTER chased four to five paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked three wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled six wide into upper stretch, closed well outside and missed at the end while just up for the place honors. VITTORIO four then three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung four then three wide into upper stretch rallying to take command at the three-sixteenths, dug in under challenge to the outside and came out five paths from the eighth pole to the sixteenth marker to get a look at the pair threatening to the outside and was nailed by both in the final strides. MAJORITY PARTNER coaxed from the gate, showed the way in hand just off the inside until tucked inside through the turn under pressure from SAGAMORE MISCHIEF every step of the way, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and got let out spinning just off the inside into upper stretch, dug in and was collared by VITTORIO with three-sixteenths to run and weakened in the late stages. BUSINESS MODEL six paths off the inside briefly, tucked to the two path six furlongs from home before taking to the rail through the turn, was placed to coaxing at the three-eighths, spun two to three wide into upper stretch and offered up a mild bid. SAGAMORE MISCHIEF led early on, then prompted the pace of MAJORITY PARTNER from the outside three then two wide, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun three wide into upper stretch and weakened. TWENTY FOUR MAMBA got away to an awkward beginning when nearly sitting down in the stall when the latch was sprung, got away askew to the left side and conceded five to six lengths immediately to the front, chased along the inside down the backstretch and then just off the inside through the turn under coaxing from the seven-sixteenths, spun three wide into upper stretch and trailed throughout.

ENTRY.NAME: Twenty Four Mamba
ENTRY.OWNER: PlayingTheField Racing Final Turn Racing Stable LLC WLIR Racing Stables and Acqu
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward st, chased ins, 2p turn, 3w upper, trailed throughout

ENTRY.NAME: Majority Partner
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, in hand 2p, ins turn, 2w 1/4p, collared 3/16, wknd lte

ENTRY.NAME: Sagamore Mischief
ENTRY.COMMENT: led early, prompted 3-2w, coaxed 5/16, 3w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Vittorio
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-3w pursuit, coaxed 5/16, 4-3w upper, up 3/16, dug in, nailed

ENTRY.NAME: Milton the Monster
ENTRY.OWNER: Scuderi Vincent S and Maher Teresa M
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-5w backstretch, coaxed 3w 3/8, 6w upper, closed well, missed

ENTRY.NAME: Dot's Dollar
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 5-4w, coaxed 5/16, 5w upper, closed well, up last jumps

ENTRY.NAME: Business Model
ENTRY.COMMENT: 6w briefly, to 2p 3/4p, inside turn, 2-3w upper, mild bid

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Fasig-Tipton Belmont Oaks Invitational S. - Grade1 BELMONT PARK RACE 8 1 1/4M Inner turf CR: 101. Stakes Purse 500000. INNER TURF AN INVITATIONAL FOR NORTHERN HEMISPHERE, AND SOUTHERN HEMISPHERE FILLIES THREE-YEARS-OLD FOALED AFTER AUGUST 1, 2019 AND BEFORE JULY 31, 2020 . Non-Lasix Race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. $3,50 0 to enter and an additional $4,000 to start. The purse for the Fasig-Tipton Belmont Oaks Invitational will be divided accordingly, $275,000 to the winner, $100,000 to second, $60,000 to third, $30,000 to fourth, $20,000 to fifth and $15,000 divided equal ly amongst the remaining finishers. Weights: Northern Hemisphere, 121 lbs. Southern Hemisphere*, 125 lbs. Trophies will be presented to the winning owner, trainer and jockey.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ASPEN GROVE (IRE) was loaded with the use of a loading blanket, broke out leaving the gate and was off a bit slow while last to commence, angled in early, saved ground under restraint on the first turn, was rated off the inside, traveled three wide on the far turn, was roused at the quarter-pole, eased out a path and replaced the tiring BE YOUR BEST outside the eighth-pole, rallied into the final furlong, closed well to get the lead just inside the sixteenth-pole and prevailed under strong urging. PREREQUISITE showed speed on the inside of a rival, set the pace while inside to the two path, was asked near the quarter-pole then came under a drive in upper stretch, led to the sixteenth-pole then was headed by the winner, fought on to the finish but missed while just able to get the place. PAPILIO (IRE) stumbled very badly at the start, went three wide on the first turn, was reserved off the pace, raced four wide on the far turn, moved out while put to a drive in upper stretch and finished with good courage to just miss the place while up for the show. ASPRAY went two to three wide on the first turn, was rated off the pace with cover, rounded the far turn in the four path, was roused five wide into the stretch, chased under a drive into the final furlong and lacked the needed kick. FREYDIS THE RED (FR) angled in early, traveled around the first turn in the two path, was reserved on the outside but with cover, went four to five wide on the far turn, was asked for her best in upper stretch and also lacked the needed kick then just missed the superfecta. SPEIRLING BEAG (IRE) was rated while inside to the two path, moved closer under restraint midway down the backstretch, saved ground on the far turn, was roused outside the quarter-pole, chased under a drive into the final furlong and lacked the needed response. MISSION OF JOY was rated inside to the two path on the first turn, raced just off the pace under stout restraint while tugging at the bit, rounded the far turn in the two path, made a bid while let out at the five-sixteenths, battled under a drive into the final furlong and weakened. STRIKINGLY SPUN raced under a tight hold while between foes into the first turn, saved ground on that bend, was reserved towards the rear, pulled her way closer midway down the backstretch, moved from the hedge to the two path on the far turn, waited behind horses from the quarter-pole to the three-sixteenths then was roused, raced behind horses under urging to near the sixteenth-pole, was not urged while behind some traffic in the final sixteenth, moved out late and failed to threaten. BE YOUR BEST (IRE) showed early speed, prompted the pace on the outside in the three path, was asked near the quarter-pole, dropped back under a drive in upper stretch and came up empty.

ENTRY.NAME: Mission of Joy
ENTRY.OWNER: RyZan Sun Racing LLC and Madaket Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: ins-2p1st turn,pulled 2p backstretch,let out5/16,bid,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Strikingly Spun
ENTRY.COMMENT: snug hold btwn,ins1st,resrvd,ins-2p2nd,wait1/4-3/16,traffic 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Speirling Beag (IRE)

TRACK.NAME: Foreign track with Code of STC

ENTRY.COMMENT: step slw brk,rated ins-2path,closer5/8,roused1/4,lckd needed kick

ENTRY.OWNER: D J Stable LLC Medallion Racing Fowler Barry and Parkland Thoroughbreds
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled severely brk,3p1st,rated,3-4p2nd,mvd out,good courage

ENTRY.OWNER: First Row Partners and Team Hanley
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed ins foe,pace ins-2path,ask1/4,led to 1/16,caught,held2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Be Your Best (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed,3p1st,prompt outside,3p2nd,ask1/4,came up empty

ENTRY.NAME: Aspray
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3p1st,rated,4p2nd,5path1/4,chased,lacked needed kick

ENTRY.NAME: Freydis the Red (FR)
ENTRY.OWNER: Walking L Thoroughbreds LLC and Three Chimneys Farm
ENTRY.COMMENT: angled in,2p1st,reserved,4-5w2nd turn,lacked needed kick

ENTRY.NAME: Aspen Grove (IRE)

TRACK.NAME: Foreign track with Code of CUR

ENTRY.OWNER: Glen Hill Farm and Magnier Mrs John
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out,bit slw,ins1st,rated,3p2nd,ask1/4,rally,bid ins1/8,up

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 9 7F Turf CR: 95. Allowance Purse 95000. (UP TO $16,530 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter Allowed 2 lbs. (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at Seven Furlongs on the Main Track.) (Rail at 27 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: APPRAISE (IRE) dueled briefly two then three wide with CLUBHOUSE to his inside before taking sole command inside five furlongs to run, tucked two wide briefly before making his way to the inside midway on the turn, cut the corner into upper stretch roused for the drive, dug in and held sway to the finish. DRAKON four then three wide in pursuit from mid pack, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung four wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive steadily gaining, then surged late to get up for the place honors in the final jumps. FAMOUS GENT forwardly placed four paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked three then two wide through the turn coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, got set down spinning just off the inside into upper stretch, offered up a mild kick to secure the show honors. WHAT SAY THEE chased five paths off the inside down the backstretch and then three wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, continued three wide into upper stretch and offered up a mild bid. SOULMATE chased four then three wide under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch, kicked on belatedly to the finish. ARUBA chased just off the inside down the backstretch and then three to four wide through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled five to six wide into upper stretch and offered no response. ELUSIVE EDGE chased just off the inside from just off the pace, had the rider pause and take brief hold at the five-sixteenths, got let out continuing in the two path into upper stretch and weakened. INFLATION NATION (IRE) bumped at the start by AIR SHOW, who broke outwards, chased along the inside down the backstretch and then just off the inside through the turn under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, angled four wide at the head of the stretch and offered no kick. CLUBHOUSE broke in brushing the near side stall at the start, showed the way briefly before dueling briefly with APPRAISE, got displaced from the front just inside the five furlong marker and was shaken off into the turn, chased along the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, continued in the inside route into upper stretch and weakened. CARPE'S DREAM chased three then two wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, spun three wide into upper stretch, tired. AIR SHOW broke out at the start bumping INFLATION NATION, chased two to three wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, angled five wide for home and made no impact. DARK VECTOR chased along the inside, had the rider take brief hold near the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch under a drive and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Dark Vector
ENTRY.OWNER: R A Hill Stable Gatsas Stables RAP Racing and Mara Chris
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, took hold 5/16, 2w 1/4p, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Elusive Edge
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, took hold 5/16, let out 2w 1/4p, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Carpe's Dream
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-2w, coaxed 3/8, 3w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Drakon
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-3w pursuit, coaxed 3/8, 4w upper, dug in, late surge

ENTRY.COMMENT: 5w backstretch, 3w turn, coaxed 5/16, 3w upper, mild bid

ENTRY.OWNER: Harrell Ventures LLC and Starlight Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: brush gate, led briefly ins, chased ins, ins 1/4, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Appraise (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled briefly 2-3w, up ins 5/8, ins turn, cut corner, held sway

ENTRY.NAME: Famous Gent
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w backstretch, 3-2w turn, set down 2w 1/4p, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Air Show
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out st, chased 2-3w, coaxed 3/8, 5w upper, no impact

ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, chased ins, coaxed 2p 5/16, angled 4w upper, no kick

ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, coaxed 3-4w 3/8, 5-6w upper, no response

ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-3w pursuit, coaxed 5/16, 5w upper, belatedly

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Belmont Derby Invitational S. - Grade1 BELMONT PARK RACE 10 1 1/4M Inner turf CR: 109. Stakes Purse 750000. INNER TURF AN INVITATIONAL FOR NORTHERN HEMISPHERE, AND SOUTHERN HEMISPHERE THREE YEAR OLDS FOALED AFTER AUGUST 1, 2019 AND BEFORE JULY 31, 2020 . Non-Lasix Race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. $5,000 to ente r and an additional $6,250 to start. The purse for the Belmont Derby Invitational will be divided accordingly, $412,500 to the owner of the winner, $150,000 to the second place finisher, $90,000 to the third place finisher, $45,000 to the fourth place fin isher, $30,000 to the fifth place finisher and $22,500 to be divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weights: Northern Hemisphere Colts and Geldings, 122 lbs. Fillies, 119 lbs. Southern Hemisphere* Colts and Geldings, 126 lbs. Fillies, 123 lbs. T rophies will be presented to the winning owner, trainer and jockey.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FAR BRIDGE bumped with foes on both sides at the start, went around the first turn in the two path, settled comfortably off the pace under some restraint, was roused while inside to the two path on the far turn, cut the corner into the stretch then moved out while picking up stride inside the three-sixteenths, rallied into the final furlong, closed strongly to make a bid outside the sixteenth-pole, was brushed by the runner-up shortly thereafter then gained the lead, brushed again with that foe late and prevailed under good handling. THE FOXES (IRE) broke a bit slow and was last to commence, angled in towards the rear, was hard held near the back in the two to three path, remained towards the rear while just behind the winner and snugly held between foes going around the far turn, jostled with a rival coming to the quarter-pole then was asked, rallied into the final furlong, gained between horses into the final sixteenth and finished with good energy to just get the place. MONDEGO (GB) was hustled from the start, moved in while showing speed, set the pace on the inside, vied along the hedge while inside of a foe on the far turn, responded well when asked at the quarter-pole, came under a drive in upper stretch, drifted out outside the sixteenth-pole then brushed with the winner, led determinedly into the final sixteenth then was collared, steadied while brushing and being outfinished by the winner late and lost the place in the final stride while just able to get the show. WEBSLINGER bumped with a rival at the start, went around the first turn in the two path, was reserved at the rear, went four then five wide on the far turn, bumped with an opponent while six wide into the stretch, drifted in some inside the three-sixteenths and improved position for the last spot in the superfeca. SILVER KNOTT (GB) bumped with a foe but broke towards the front, moved in while forwardly spotted early, saved ground just behind the leader on the first turn, was rated just off the pace, moved to the two path around the three-quarter pole then turned up the pressure, vied in the two path on the far turn, was asked near the quarter-pole, battled under a drive into the final furlong and weakened. MENDELSSOHNS MARCH settled on the inside, was roused on the far turn and failed to rally. REDISTRICTING (GB) went four wide on the first turn, was reserved towards the rear, traveled three then four wide on the final turn, bumped with an opponent while five wide into the stretch and failed to threaten. KALIK was fractious loading and in the gate, bumped with a rival at the start, steadied briefly while having his path taken early, went four then five wide on the first turn, settled on the outside, went three wide on the far turn, was asked for his best into upper stretch and came up empty. WIZARD OF WESTWOOD bumped with a rival at the start, was taken under a very tight hold early, rounded the first turn in the two to three path, tracked the pace on the outside, chased three then two wide on the far turn and capitulated. CYBER NINJA was hard held near the back on the inside, jostled with a foe at the quarter-pole then was roused and was no factor. BOPPY O dropped back early, went three to four wide on the first turn, was reserved on the outside without the benefit of cover, raced four wide while roused on the far turn and failed to respond.

ENTRY.NAME: Mendelssohns March
ENTRY.OWNER: Harold Lerner LLC Nehoc Stables AWC Stables and Team Stallion Racing Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside,roused 2nd turn,failed to rally

ENTRY.NAME: Boppy O

ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-4w1st,reserved outside,no cover,ask4w2nd turn,empty

ENTRY.COMMENT: hard held inside,jostled 1/4,failed to threaten

ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,2p1st,well back,4-5w2nd,bmpd6w1/4,drift in,improved

ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,2p1st,settled,ins-2p2nd,mvd out3/16,rallied,brshd,up

ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,speed,ins1st,rated,2p3/4,vied 2p2nd turn,wknd final1/8

ENTRY.OWNER: Warren Andrew N and Warren Rania
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,tight hold,2-3p1st,tracked outside,ask3-2p2nd,empty

ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious gate,bmp brk,stdy early,4-5p1st,settled,3w2nd,empty

ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,mvd in,ins pace,ask1/4,responded,led past1/16,caught,stdy

ENTRY.NAME: Redistricting (GB)
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w1st,reserved,3-4w2nd turn,bmpd 5w1/4,no threat

TRACK.NAME: Foreign track with Code of EPS

ENTRY.COMMENT: off bit slw,mvd in,hard held 2-3p,jstld1/4,ask,btwn1/16,gd enrgy

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Victory Ride S. - Grade3 BELMONT PARK RACE 11 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 99. Stakes Purse 175000. FOR FILLIES, THREE-YEARS-OLD. Non-Lasix Race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $175 each which should accompany the nomination; $875 to pass the entry box and an additional $875 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $875 in addition to the entry and starting fees) may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the owner of the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6%t o fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a Graded sweepstake allowed 2 lbs.; of a sweepstake in 2023 allowed 4 lbs.; of a sweepstake or a race other than maiden, claiming, starter or ss tate-bred allowance in 2023 allowed 6 lbs. A trophy will be presented to the winning owner. Closed Saturday, June 24, 2023 with 22 Nominations.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAPLE LEAF MEL established the front and showed the way in hand just off the inside through swift splits, had RED CARPET READY advance and latch on outside near the five-sixteenths, remained patiently handled shaking off that rival continued just off the inside into upper stretch, got placed to light urging and edged away to the eighth pole, got roused under a light drive inside that station being shown the crop to the right side and receiving a lone tap until the sixteenth marker and then got hand urged to the finish to hold well and clear to the end. DAZZLING BLUE chased along the inside coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, swung three wide into upper stretch, proved no match for the top one while chasing her home along willingly for the place honors. VAHVA chased just off the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled five wide into upper stretch, offered up a mild kick. INTERPOLATE bobbled after the start, chased along the inside under coaxing from the three-eighths, continued in the inside route into upper stretch and passed tired rivals. DOWNTOWN MISCHIEF three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled five wide into upper stretch and tired. TOPSY four then three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled out five wide into upper stretch and tired. RED CARPET READY forwardly placed four to five paths off the inside down the backstretch, tucked three then two wide offering up a bid at the five-sixteenths to latch on the eventual winner to the outside, angled four wide into upper stretch and was shaken off, then folded in the stretch. ADELIESE'S SMILE chased three then two wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, tipped three to four wide at the head of the stretch, tired in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Interpolate
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled after st, chased ins, coaxed 3/8, ins 1/4, by tired foes

ENTRY.NAME: Dazzling Blue
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, coaxed near 1/4, 3w upper, no match, willingly

ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2p, coaxed 5/16, angled 5w upper, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Adeliese's Smile
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-2w, coaxed 3/8, 3-4w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Maple Leaf Mel
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand 2p, 2w 1/4p, light drive ins 1/8, held well and clear

ENTRY.NAME: Downtown Mischief
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w pursuit, coaxed 3/8, angled 5w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Topsy
ENTRY.OWNER: Heiligbrodt L William Heiligbrodt Corinne and Jackpot Farm
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-3w pursuit, coaxed 3/8, 5w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Red Carpet Ready
ENTRY.OWNER: Ashbrook Farm and Upland Flats Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-5w backstretch, tucked 3-2w turn, bid 5/16, 4w upper, folded

RACE.RACE_TEXT: BELMONT PARK RACE 12 6F Inner turf CR: 87. Waiver Maiden Claiming Purse 45000. INNER TURF FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $40,000 (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Due At Time Of Claim Otherwise Clai m Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BURN JAKEY BURN dueled on the outside, moved clear coming to the half-mile pole, went around the turn in the two path, spun three wide into the stretch, responded well under good handling into the final furlong, shortened stride into the final sixteenth and held desperately in a big effort. BOSTON STRONG MAMA moved in early then was well placed, went around the turn in the two path, spun three wide into the stretch, remained on her inside lead until outside the furlong marker, gained on the winner while inside that foe into the final sixteenth and just missed while able to get the place. SCREW LOOSE settled inside under some urging, was shuffled back off the heels of IT'S NOT MY FAULT between the three-eighths pole and the five-sixteenths, moved to the two path in the process, shifted three wide outside the quarter-pole, was roused while swinging five wide into the stretch and finished with good energy to just get the show. HERONEANDONLY raced on the outside in the second flight, was urged four wide on the turn, floated six wide into the stretch, drifted in inside the three-sixteenths, kept on in the final furlong and narrowly missed the show. BLUE PLATE SPECIAL was urged along off the pace, went around the turn in the two path, was driven three wide into the stretch and finished willingly but missed the superfecta. LEFTEMBEHIND was off slow then taken up, spotted the front several lengths, traveled around the turn in the two path, brushed with a rival outside the quarter-pole then came three wide at the quarter-pole, drifted inward in upper stretch and improved position. SINALOA was bumped solidly at the start and a bit slow into stride, settled at the rear, went three wide on the turn, hesitated while splitting foes inside the furlong marker and never reached contention. KERN RIVER dueled on the inside of the winner, dropped back nearing the half-mile pole, chased two then three wide on the turn, moved to the two path under a drive into the stretch and tired. REAP WHAT YOU SOW broke out and bumped solidly with a rival, moved in while settling off the pace, was roused three wide on the turn, came four wide into the stretch and failed to rally. GIO'S MAJESTICNESS came inward at the start then dropped back, settled on the outside, went three wide on the turn, brushed with a foe outside the quarter-pole, shifted five wide into the stretch, drifted in inside the furlong marker and was no factor. IT'S NOT MY FAULT was urged along in the second flight, saved ground on the turn and came up empty. BAY BANK settled towards the rear while well off the pace, saved ground on the turn and failed to threaten.

ENTRY.NAME: Screw Loose
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled some urging,shuffled off heels3/8-5/16,5w1/4,good energy

ENTRY.NAME: Blue Plate Special
ENTRY.OWNER: Goldfarb Sanford J Casal Jorge Tanzman David and Speranza Steven
ENTRY.COMMENT: urged along,2path turn,3path1/4,willingly,missed super

ENTRY.COMMENT: towards rear,inside turn,failed to threaten

ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out,bmpd,mvd in,settled,3w turn,4w1/4,no rally

ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,slw into stride,3w turn,split foes ins1/8,no threat

ENTRY.COMMENT: came in brk,dropped back,3w trn,5w1/4,brshd,drift in1/8,no factor
